messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level B1

Text saved: In the last 200 years, technology and health got better. This meant that fewer children died when they were young. This caused the number of people in the world to grow very quickly. These large families had even more children who grew up and had their own families. But things changed in the 1960s. Contraception, which are methods to prevent pregnancy, became easier to get. Because of this, the average number of babies for each woman in the world has gone down from six to only two.

metadata.feedback_text: The assessment could not be completed because the 'Writer's Output' text was not provided. The submission included an original text, keywords, and a vocabulary analysis, but the essential component for evaluation—the writer's own text—is missing. To perform a B1 CEFR evaluation, a complete paragraph written by the user is necessary to assess structure, flow, vocabulary usage, and factual accuracy.

messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level B1

Text saved: In the last 200 years, technology and health have improved. As a result, fewer children died when they were young. This caused the world's population to grow very quickly. Large families had more children who grew up and had their own families. However, things changed in the 1960s. Contraception, which is a way to prevent pregnancy, became easier to get. Because of this, the average number of babies for each woman has gone down. It has dropped from six to only two.

metadata.feedback_text: This is an excellent example of B1 writing. The text successfully demonstrates all key competencies for this level. The structure and flow are very strong; you have used a good mix of simple and more complex sentences. Your use of connectors like 'As a result', 'who', and 'Because of this' links ideas logically and creates a coherent paragraph. The sentence 'Contraception, which is a way to prevent pregnancy, became easier to get' is a perfect demonstration of the B1 ability to define a term using a relative clause. The vocabulary is appropriate for the B1 level, and the text is factually accurate, correctly summarizing all key points from the original.
